result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine Oliver Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antoine Oliver Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not  needed.

Defendant Antoine Oliver Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Restitution Hearing. Victim in this matter did not appear. State unable to meet burden as to restitution. Court sets restitution in this matter at ZERO.

Defendant Antoine Oliver Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Restitution Hearing. State not prepared to proceed, witness unavailable. State requested an adjournment, defense objects. Matter adjourned to branch 23 for Restitution Hearing. Defendant's apperance WAIVED. Matter set at 3:00 PM.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Shanette F. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26209605 in court 1x on 5/29/15.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Miguel C. c/o Shanette F. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26209604 in court 1x.
Witness fee request prepared for Shanette F., Miguel C. was approved for 1 appearance each on 5/29/15 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.

Defendant Antoine Oliver Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 4 DAYS time served, with full Huber privileges.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management - based on evaluation.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Jacqueline L., Shanette F, or Nancy Y, unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Restitution to be determined at Restitution Hearing.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Witness fee request prepared for Miguel C., Shanette F. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Antoine Oliver Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion on the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, but Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s). Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Discussion regarding modification of the No Contact order.  Arguments from each party.  Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jacqueline L. and Nancy Y., further court allowed defendant to be at the residence of 3281 N. 52nd Street from 12:00 PM (NOON) to 6:00 PM on March 21 & March 22 ONLY.

Defendant Antoine Oliver Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. All motions to be filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS in advance of Jury Trial date.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM010465  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-01-15

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JACQUELINE L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antoine Oliver Smith in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Antoine Oliver Smith in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
